p: Finally, hesperetin, a flavonoid present in citrus pericarp and albedo ( Citrus aurantium, Citrus reticulata), showed dose-dependent inhibition of SARS M pro in a recent in vitro study [ 98]. In a recent in silico study, it was shown that hesperetin has the potential to inhibit the ACE2 receptor, suggesting that this molecule might bind ACE2 and might interfere with SARS-CoV-2 infection [ 71]. Furthermore, hesperidin, a hesperitin glycoside, showed the potential to inhibit many proteins related to SARS-CoV-2 by interfering with their viral cycle [ 85]. These results underline the importance of further studies regarding this molecule and its industrial extraction process from citrus peel.
